definition: to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: She’s always grousing about the work-load.
And those grownup who lose to a kid have the audacity to complaint?
sentences.chinese: 这些输了的成年人还有脸抱怨？

sentences.english: They said the targe was out of reach.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨说这个目标无法达成。

sentences.english: She complained to the police about the barking of her neighbour's dog.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方抱怨邻居家的狗叫声。

sentences.english: Don't complain beneath the stars about the lack of bight sopts in your life.
sentences.chinese: 不要在星星下抱怨生活中缺乏色彩。

sentences.english: His main complaint was that, at just three lanes, the M25 was not big or bold enough.
sentences.chinese: 他那时还抱怨说M25公路只有三车道，不够宽。

sentences.english: I neither complain for lacking money nor hostile to riches and honour.
sentences.chinese: 淡薄名利，宁静致远，既不抱怨贫贱又不仇视富贵。

sentences.english: Perhaps it is because we would otherwise have to lament our limits.
sentences.chinese: 或许是因为如此一来我们便会抱怨自己的限界。

sentences.english: Residents of many major urban areas complain of 20-hour-long daily blackouts.
sentences.chinese: 很多大城市的居民抱怨每天断电时间长达20小时。

sentences.english: Their main grievance was that they had not received their pitiably low pay.
sentences.chinese: 他们主要的抱怨是没有拿到那少得可怜的工资。

sentences.english: She complained to me about his impoliteness.
Website managers also complain that their CMS is hard to use.
sentences.chinese: 网站管理人员也抱怨说，他们的CMS很难使用。

sentences.english: A man complained about a "constant inexplicable cough".
sentences.chinese: 一个男士抱怨他的持续无故咳嗽。

sentences.english: Virtually every new company complains about the difficulty of raising seed capital.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每家新公司都在抱怨筹措原始资本的困难性。

sentences.english: I'm fed up with your complaints.

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to feel wronged/to cause sb to feel wronged/grievance
to chatter or jabber on and on
